node.title: 'Our deepest regret': Major disability service provider apologises for violence, abuse in group homes
node.alt: A man in shadow leans on a walker as he faces away from camera in a corridor inside a group home
node.description: One of Australia's biggest disability service providers apologises for incidents of violence, abuse and neglect in two of its group homes, telling a royal commission they "could have done more" to help residents.
node.content:
["One of Australia's biggest disability service providers has apologised after\u00a0incidents of violence, abuse and neglect in two of its group homes.", "Life Without Barriers (LWB) fronted the disability royal commission to answer questions yesterday after four days of evidence from residents and their families.", "In one case, a female resident in a Melbourne home was hit over the head with a chair by another resident three times, and did not receive proper medical care for a fractured finger for five days.", "At another home in Lismore, in northern NSW, a female resident was allegedly indecently and sexually assaulted by a support worker.", "LWB\u00a0operates disability services around Australia and New Zealand and its revenue exceeded\u00a0$750 million last year.", "Chief executive officer Claire Robbs apologised to each of the residents and their families who had shared their stories.", "\"The views and experiences of people and their families have highlighted several areas where harm has been caused to people and we acknowledge and offer our deepest regret,\" Ms Robbs said.", "
'Sexual misconduct' inside group home\u00a0
", "The royal commission was told\u00a0about the treatment and care of residents at an\u00a0LWB home near Lismore, which accommodated\u00a0four people with multiple disabilities.", "One of the resident's mothers told the inquiry about the experiences of her daughter, Natalie*, who lives with cerebral palsy and a moderate intellectual disability.", "The 32-year-old is a wheelchair user and is mostly non-verbal.", "Her mother, Jennifer*, told the hearing that when Natalie entered the home in early 2012 she requested all her daughter's personal care, such as\u00a0bathing, be done by female carers only, a request she believed was agreed to by LWB.", "She said her daughter seemed \"scared\" of the support workers.", "In 2015, staff contacted Jennifer to inform her a police investigation was underway after a male support worker allegedly indecently assaulted Natalie while\u00a0performing personal care.", "He was charged with aggravated indecent assault of a person with physical disability and sexual intercourse of a person with cognitive impairment.", "The man was found not guilty at a jury trial in September 2017.", "After the incident, Jennifer told the inquiry there were meetings to discuss Natalie's safety and care where LWB staff became \"very aggressive\".", "\"LWB's failure to have women only attending Natalie's personal care enabled the assaults on my daughter to occur,\" Jennifer said.", "The inquiry was told\u00a0LWB had not apologised to Natalie nor Jennifer for the assaults, nor for the fact that there was a male support worker delivering personal care.", "", "
Jennifer said LWB treated her daughter, Natalie, \"like a commodity\".(File photo)
", "In March 2020, Natalie was rushed to hospital and \"nearly died\" following a bowel obstruction and LWB had failed to provide medical charts of her bowel care.", "The commission also heard evidence about the \"mishandling\" of Natalie's finances by LWB staff.", "\"LWB treated Natalie like a commodity because she had a large [NDIS] funding plan,\" Jennifer said.", "\"It was like they felt they had ownership of Natalie.\"", "", "
Claire Robbs apologised to each resident and their family.(ABC News: Anthony Scully)
", "Ms Robbs apologised to Natalie and Jennifer and acknowledged their \"pain and trauma\".", "\"The sexual misconduct by a staff member is completely unacceptable \u2026 our delay in offering a genuine and human response was also unacceptable,\" Ms Robbs said.", "Jennifer told the hearing she had spent years looking for a new home for Natalie, and was \"so happy\" in late 2020 when a unit was found.", "'I'm not sure she would have survived [the Lismore home]\u00a0much longer,\" Jennifer said.", "The unit is with a new disability services provider and Natalie was now \"thriving\".", "\"We feel like we have our old Natalie back,\" Jennifer said.", "
Conflict and violence became 'normal'
", "The royal commission also heard about a LWB home in Melbourne where five residents \u2014\u00a0men and women with various complex disabilities \u2014\u00a0lived together.", "Violence between the housemates occurred regularly. In one incident, a resident was hit over the head by another housemate with a plastic chair, the inquiry was told.", "The female resident tried to \"shield\" herself using her hand and it was later discovered her finger was fractured.", "Catherine* gave evidence about the experiences of her autistic daughter, Rebecca*, who also lives with intellectual disability.", "Rebecca, now 44 years old, moved into the home in 2011.", "Catherine told the hearing one resident was \"physically and verbally abusive\" to other residents and there was \"tension, anxiety and unease\" in the house which made Rebecca \"scared\" to be there.", "\"Conflict and even violence in the Melbourne house had somehow become normal and had been accepted as a fact of life,\" Catherine said.", "\"I do not believe I was told about each and every incident \u2026\u00a0it was very distressing and I was constantly worried about Rebecca.\"", "Catherine told the inquiry of a \"terrible incident\" in 2018 when her daughter was dragged by another resident, leaving her with carpet burns on her knees, bruising and a \"large clump\" of hair missing.", "LWB told Catherine they didn't call a doctor because it was not \"an open wound\".", "", "
Disability service provider LWB had more than\u00a0$750 million in revenue last year.(ABC News: Patrick Stone)
", "When her daughter's knee became infected, Catherine took Rebecca to the doctor herself.", "\"I felt that the decision not to call a doctor for Rebecca on this occasion was irresponsible,\" she said.", "In a separate incident, Rebecca was given another resident's medication which caused her to have an allergic reaction, but Catherine said a doctor, again, was not called.", "The inquiry was told Rebecca has moved from the house to live independently with one-to-one support.", "
'We could have done more', chief executive\u00a0admits
", "Paul, a foster father of another resident, told the royal commission the violence between residents and towards support workers in the home was \"traumatic\".", "There was an \"excessive\" use of agency staff and a high turnover of management and house supervisors, the inquiry heard.", "Ms Robbs apologised to the residents and their families of the Melbourne home.", "\"No home should feel violent and unpredictable,\" Ms Robbs said.", "\"We could have done more to respond to and reduce where violence was occurring between people in the home.\"", "The Melbourne house is no longer being run by LWB.", "In November 2020, parents of the residents agreed to replace the provider.", "Commission chair Ronald Sackville said the disability royal commission had now received 3,355 submissions since it began in April 2019.", "The next public hearing will take place in February and examine the experiences of people with disability working in Australian Disability Enterprises (ADEs).", "* Real names not used by\u00a0the royal commission to protect the privacy of witnesses and residents."]
